title: Pentatonic Scales
description: Learn major and minor pentatonic scales — the most widely used scales in popular music.

steps.title: What is Pentatonic?
steps.description: 'Penta' means five. Pentatonic scales use only 5 notes instead of 7. By removing the two 'tension' notes from a major or minor scale, you get a scale that sounds good no matter what order you play the notes. That's why pentatonic scales are used in rock, blues, pop, country, and folk music worldwide.

steps.title: C Major Pentatonic
steps.description: Play the C major pentatonic scale: C, D, E, G, A. Notice that F and B are removed — these are the notes that create the most tension in the major scale.

steps.title: A Minor Pentatonic
steps.description: Play the A minor pentatonic scale: A, C, D, E, G. This is the most popular scale for guitar and keyboard solos!

steps.title: A Secret Connection
steps.description: C major pentatonic and A minor pentatonic contain the exact same notes! C-D-E-G-A = A-C-D-E-G. They're called 'relative' scales. The difference is which note feels like 'home' — C for major, A for minor.

steps.title: G Major Pentatonic
steps.description: Play the G major pentatonic: G, A, B, D, E.
